availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David J. Jones (Kenton County, Kentucky, boiler rolling mill.)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, boiler rolling mill. Native of Carmanthanshire, South Wales. Married to Ann Jones. Father of William Jones, Catherine Jones, Mary Jones, Jane M. Jones, and Margaret E. Jones. Boiler rolling mill in Kenton County in 1860. Boiler in Kenton County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 1, p. 551.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 1, pp. 341A-B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 6th Congressional District, Vol. 3, June and July 1863, p. 122, p. 245 of microfilm, (Accessed via ancestry.com on March 25, 2020).
Find A Grave, "David J. Jones (1821-August 11, 1873)," Memorial #94964382, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/94964382 (accessed February 21, 2019).
